svcsubproc.title: Step Well Tread Plates
svcsubproc.para: The step well assembly and step tread plates are removable. The step well tread plates should be checked for excessive wear and/or damage on a regular basis. If wear on the step tread is discovered, the section should be replaced immediately.

step1.para: The step treads are secured utilizing mounting screws and an adhesive to secure the tread to the step well assembly.
Locate the six mounting screws in the step tread, loosen and remove the screws, and remove step tread panel.
After removing the step tread, remove any adhesive and sealer along the outside surfaces of the area where the tread was removed.

To remove the tread panel at the entrance to the center aisle and adjacent to the driver platform, locate the six mounting screws securing the edge trim piece at the joint between the center aisle flooring and the entrance panel to be removed. Loosen and remove the trim strip mounting screws.

Locate the 4 driver seat mounting bolts and nuts securing the driver seat to the floor and entrance tread panel. Loosen and remove the mounting bolts with an assistant under the bus to remove the lock nuts.
Locate and remove the engine cover mounting bolts along the rear edge of the engine cover.
Remove the remaining 2 mounting screws from edge trim at the engine cover to the step well.
Remove the seal along the edge of the tread panel at the top step.
Remove the entrance panel step tread.
Remove and clean any adhesive on the floor panels used to secure the entrance tread panel.
